comments.author: Marina@Picnic at Marina
comments.content: That meal definitely tastes great, with all garlic-lemon-parsley-tarragon flavor! I wouldn't even use ricotta, just the gremolata and garlic. Beautiful presentation on a lovely Italian (?) plate. Have you made orecchiette? I'd like to try to make it from scratch (well, no other options available for me here), but haven't find a recipe yet. I watch a video how to form it, but no recipe of flour/water proportion. I heard it's different from a regular pasta, is it? Have a great week, Michael!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Marina - nope, I haven't made fresh orecchiette from scratch. Here's a promising looking recipe from Smitten Kitchen: http://smittenkitchen.com/2006/12/little-ears-big-chew/ though.

comments.author: Vegan
comments.content: Such a perfect, fresh combination! garlic scapes, ricotta, and gremolata, together at last. This dish was really enjoyable!

comments.author: Maureen
comments.content: I got all excited, thinking that orechiette sure looked like whole grain.....but you don't mention it in your recipe.  Are you holding out on us, Michael?  I'd love to find some!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Nope, regular white flour orecchiette. I've frankly never found a whole-grain pasta that I think is good. Every few years someone will tell me they have found a brand that is "just like" the real thing, and I try it and the texture is all wrong.
